meanings.definition: A building, especially a large or imposing one.
meanings.sent1: The old edifices in the city stood tall and grand.
meanings.sent2: The ancient edifices in Rome attract many tourists.
meanings.sent3: The edifices in the story seemed to have a life of their own.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like fragile edifices, easily shattered.
meanings.sent5: The crumbling edifices whispered stories of the past.

meanings.sent1: His mind was a maze of conflicting edifices.
meanings.sent2: The edifices of superstition can be hard to break down.
meanings.sent3: The edifices of tradition were challenged by new ideas.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the edifices of doubt slowly crumbled.
meanings.sent5: The edifices of culture shaped their worldview.
